title: Body Switch
author: Saddleback Educational Publishing
description: A wish comes true in a mysterious restaurant. Two boys switch places. Brian Stark is a normal middle school kid. He is bored with his family. School is a drag. Watching his little sister is a total pain. Jamie Hawk is an international pop star sensation with a ton of money, but he has no normal life. His dad bosses him around. He has no privacy. He never sees his mom. Zap! With a crack of lightning and a selfie, it all changes.

title: Hero of Crows Crossing
author: Saddleback Educational Publishing
description: Tazmin loves her new fourth grade teacher Mr. Ridley because he actually seems dedicated to teaching the poor children of the broken-down Crow’s Crossing School, and she defends his strange behavior, like digging holes in the middle of the night.

title: Ghost Mountain
author: Saddleback Educational Publishing
description: Luke Lawson is raising two couch potatoes, and that does not sit well with him. So he decides he’s going to toughen up his two boys, Winston and Nelson, with an adventure in the great outdoors. At first, the boys are grumpy and upset, but as they explore nature, they become more curious and interested in the world around them. And Winston experiences a life-changing event when he meets the ghost of a Native American teen and takes a mellow midnight ride on horseback.

title: Dream of the Dead
author: Marie Seth
description: Was it really happening, or was it all just a dream?  Diana was less and less sure.  The ghost of a Scottish girl dead for 200 years was slowly taking control of her mind.  Not even Mark, who loved her, could bring her back now.  For now Diana was dreaming the dream of the dead.

title: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer
author: Mark Twain
description: Twain's famous novel captures the atmosphere of life in the Mississippi River towns in which Mark Twain spent his own youth. Although Twain tells the tales of Tom's childhood in a humorous way, Tom's adventures have a serious side.  During a search for buried treasure, Tom and his friends witness a murder. After Tom agrees to tell his story in court, he becomes a target of the murderer's plan for revenge. Surrounded by danger and superstition, Tom and his friends struggle with important questions about responsibility, freedom, friendship, and their place in society.  This Pacemaker Classic is an adapted story. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original story.

chapters.title: 5 A Pirate with a Broken Heart

title: The Jungle Book
author: Rudyard Kipling
description: The collection of imaginative stories is set in a world where animals can talk and sing and dance. They have their own cultures and their own laws. The stories revolve around a young boy, a ""man cub"", who is orphaned in the jungle. A pack of wolves adopts the boy and raises him. As he grows up in the jungle he meets many amazing animal characters and learns many valuable lessons. Join this boy, called Mowgli, on all his fantastic adventures.  This is an adapted story. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original story.

title: Crash Dive
author: Lee Frederick
description: The U-1X is a new kind of U-boat, out to do what no German submarine had ever done before. Her captain was Commander Heinrich Rohmer, a man who knew every trick in the book about hunting and sinking ships.   The Lancer is an American destroyer in battle for the first time. Captain William Coffey was in command. His last ship had been sunk by a U-boat. This time he wanted it to be the other way around. It would be torpedoes against depth charges in a battle only one ship could win.

title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
description: Chances are you’ve heard the name Sherlock Holmes. There have been countless books, TV shows, and movies about or based on Mr. Holmes and his loyal friend and assistant Dr. Watson. Watson narrates these stories about the super-genius detective Sherlock Holmes following clues, wearing disguises, and using logic to solve his cases. Through these short stories, Arthur Conan Doyle introduced his timeless detective character to the world.  This Pacemaker Classic is an adapted collection. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the stories are very similar to the original stories.

chapters.title: 1. The Adventure of the Speckled Band
2. The Adventure of the Man with the Twisted Lip
3. The Adventure of the Blue Carbuncle
4. The Adventure of the Final Problem
5. The Adventure of the Empty House
6. The Adventure of the Priory School
7. The Adventure of the Six Napoleons

title: Little Big Top
author: Doris Hiller
description: Blowing the show: That's what circus people call it when you leave before the season is over.  Ben Vincent won't blow the show. He likes to finish everything he starts.  He wants to become an acrobat, to fly high in the Big Top with the Great Zellinis. However, someone is at work to change his plans, to finish him before he flies in the little big top.

title: David Copperfield
author: Charles Dickens
description: Charles Dickens wrote over a dozen novels, but he called this one his favorite. Perhaps that’s because David is so very much like him. It’s widely known that this story of a young boy’s difficult path to manhood is highly autobiographical. Like Dickens, David is made to work long hours in a factory at an early age. The characters, too, are similar to people in Dickens’s life. David’s friendly landlord, Mr. Micawber, seems very close to what Dickens’s father was like, and, of course, Dora is a portrait of Dickens’s own first love. This novel is an insight into the life of one of America’s most popular authors.   This Pacemaker Classic is an adapted story. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original story.
genre: Abuse,Action,Adapted Texts,Adventure,Authors,Betrayal,British,Challenges,Change,Classic,Daily Life,Death,Deception,England,Family,Fiction,Friendship,Historical Fiction,Human Life,Illustrated Books,Jobs,Learning,Life Experiences,Love,Marriage,Mistreatment,Money,Narrative,Novels,Pacemaker Classics,Poverty,Relationships,Running Away,Teachers,Wealth,Youth

title: Three Musketeers
author: Alexandre Dumas
description: A poor young man named d’Artagnan has just arrived in Paris, desiring to become a member of King Louis XIII’s royal guard regiment, the Musketeers. His prospects don’t look too good. On his first day in town, he manages to be challenged to duel three separate Musketeers: Athos, Porthos, and Aramis. As the duels are about to begin, a band of soldiers from a rival regiment happens by the field. When a scuffle breaks out, d’Artagnan chooses the side of his revered Musketeers.  He proves himself to be honorable, bold, and extremely handy with a sword. From that point on, he is included when the Muskateers call out, “All for one, and one for all!”  This Pacemaker Classic is an adapted story. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original story.

title: Alamo Wars
author: Ray Villareal
description: Students are putting on a play, written by a teacher of theirs who has died. However, there is more going on than just a school production. Read about the themes of illegal immigration and bullying.

title: The Last Book in the Universe
author: Rodman Philbrick
description: This book is set in a futuristic city that has suffered an earthquake and has an area for genetically improved people and an area for outcasts (the poor, thieves, gangs, and other unfortunate individuals). The main character is 14-year-old Spaz, who goes on a journey to save his younger sister Bean. Bean is dying of blood sickness.

title: Virtual War
author: Gloria Skurzynski
description: This book, set in the 2082, will have you rooting for Corgan, the fastest human ever created.

title: Ask Me No Questions
author: Marina Budhos
description: After 9/11, Nadira's life changes. Find out what it's like for her to live as an illegal alien, hoping to be granted citizenship, only to have her parents separated from her.
genre: Bravery,City Life,Courage,Cultures,Danger,Decisions,Depression,Fiction,Friendship,Immigrants,Loneliness,New York,Novels,People of Color,Realistic Fiction,Real Life Situations,Relationships,Sisters

title: Heidi
author: Johanna Spyri
description: This is the heartwarming story about a young girl named Heidi whose friendliness and good nature make her a favorite amongst her grandfather and friends. When Heidi moves away from her grandfather to live with a family in town, her longing for home threatens her health. So after she returns to live with her grandfather wonderful things happen to her friend Clara who visits.

chapters.title: I Up the Mountain to Alm-Uncle

title: A Christmas Carol
author: Charles Dickens
description: Ebenezer Scrooge is, to put it mildly, an extremely grumpy man. He does not feel sympathy for anyone, even at Christmas time. One Christmas Eve, Scrooge is visited by three ghosts—the Ghost of Christmas Past, who lets Scrooge see how he once loved Christmas and how he started on the wrong path; the Ghost of Christmas Present, who shows him how other people will be enjoying the holiday; and the Ghost of Christmas Yet To Come, who shows Scrooge that no one will care when he dies. Will Scrooge change his feelings toward Christmas and his fellow human beings, or will he continue to say, “Bah! Humbug!”?   This is an adapted story. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original story.

title: The Other Side of the Sky
author: Farah Ahmedi and Tamim Ansary
description: Read about the journey from war to peace. Farah Ahmedi grew up in Kabul, Afghanistan, but war forced her to flee. She endures refugee camps before making her way to America. Her remarkable journey is as  full of strife as it is inspiring.

title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
description: Chances are you’ve heard the name Sherlock Holmes. There have been countless books, TV shows, and movies about or based on Mr. Holmes and his loyal friend and assistant Dr. Watson. Watson narrates these stories about the super-genius detective Sherlock Holmes following clues, wearing disguises, and using logic to solve his cases. Through these short stories, Arthur Conan Doyle introduced his timeless detective character to the world.  This is an adapted collection. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the stories are very similar to the original stories.

title: Treasure Island
author: Robert Louis Stevenson
description: When a mysterious sailor dies in sinister circumstances at the Admiral Benbow Inn, young Jim Hawkins stumbles across a treasure map among the dead man’s possessions. Jim soon becomes aware that he is not the only one who knows of the map’s existence. His bravery and cunning are tested when he sets sail with Squire Trelawney and Dr. Livesey to track down the treasure horde. With its memorable characters and exciting plot of pirates, treachery, and heroism, this book holds a place as one of the greatest adventure stories.  This is an adapted story. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original story.

title: The Secret Garden
author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
description: When Mary Lennox arrives at her uncle's mansion, she quickly encounters a number of secrets. She learns that she has a cousin, who is handicapped, and there is a garden behind a gate that has been locked for years. Mary is determined to bring life back to the garden, and, in the process, nurtures life in the people of the mansion as well.

title: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer
author: Mark Twain
description: How much trouble can two young, mischievous boys get into in a small town? Lots. Especially when Tom and Huck witnesses a murder and decide to flee the town and live on an island as pirates instead. The trouble mounts when the wrong man is blamed for the murder, and when the boys are gone so long that the town presumes them dead! Note to the reader: This book uses the original language common at the time in which Mark Twain wrote this novel.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
description: Huckleberry Finn's adventures with a runaway slave, Jim, takes him up and down the Mississippi River. The pair encounter thieves, a drunken father, slave catchers, and even Finn's friend Tom Sawyer. Will Finn and Jim make it to safety or will Jim be enslaved again? Note to the reader: This book uses the original language common at the time in which Mark Twain wrote this novel.

title: Black Beauty
author: Anna Sewell
description: This story follows the full and intense life of a horse - told in his own words! Follow Black Beauty's autobiography as he remembers his childhood, meets friends, grows up, and is sold to a number of different owners.

title: Narrative of the Life of Frederick Douglass
author: Frederick Douglass
description: In this first-person account, Frederick Douglass describes his life as a slave, his journey as a runaway slave, and, finally, his life as a free slave.

title: The Wonderful Wizard of Oz
author: Frank Baum
description: At home in Kansas, Dorothy and her dog, Toto, are swept up by a tornado and land in the mysterious land of Oz. Dorothy and Toto are told that the powerful wizard of Oz will be able to help them get home, so they set out on a journey across the strange land to find the wizard. Along the way, Dorothy fights unusual enemies and makes unexpected friends. Will she and Toto make it back to the farm in Kansas?
